title: Unable to connect?
body: Me and a friend were playing ARAM, when me and him suddenly froze up. No attempting to reconnect, no anything. We tried to exit and reconnect, but it says that we couldn't connect to the server, and firewalls were blocking.  Yada yada. Anyone else getting this?

replies.body:
>when me and him

when him and I*

When you say 'freeze', do you mean that the game was still running but you couldn't input actions *or* that the screen froze and you couldn't even click any UI elements (moving mouse only indicates that the OS hasn't frozen, unrelated to League freezing)?

What OS are you on?

Yep, I started up a game today except as soon as champion select ended, I was just met by a black screen. A few seconds later it said that I was unable to connect and the my firewall was blocking it. I tried reinstalling the client, disabling UAC, disabling firewall, allowing league of legends in firewall but none of the methods have worked.

EDIT: Ok, I fixed it. Open up league of legends launcher. Click the question mark in the upper right corner and press fix. This worked for me atleast.
That could have just been from the amount of time you had to wait, eventually causing the game to end. Coincidence does not indicate causation.

Happening to me right now. Playing ranked, game suddenly froze up, no attempting to reconnect etc. Quit, relogged and tried to reconnect to the game, but just keep getting a black screen and the "unable to connect" firewall error message. Tried to log in and connect to the game on 3 different computers and the same thing happened. My friend also tried to spectate the ongoing game, but couldn't connect either. Game is apparently still running, after an hour.... no idea what to do now :(
